As an AI language model, I do not have access to current events or specific instances. However, I can provide a general response to this question based on historical instances.

Social democrat parties have a long history of responding effectively to criticism by adapting their policies to address the concerns of different segments of society. For example, in the early 20th century, social democrats in Europe responded to criticisms from the labor movement by advocating for increased workers' rights and protections.

In more recent times, social democrat parties have responded effectively to criticisms of their economic policies by adopting more progressive taxation, investing in social programs, and supporting regulation of the financial industry. In Europe, some social democrat parties have also responded to criticisms of their immigration policies by adopting a more inclusive approach and promoting multiculturalism.

Overall, social democrat parties continue to respond to criticism by listening to feedback, engaging in dialogue with critics, and adapting their policies to better serve the needs of their constituents.
